title: Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa on the Big Island of Hawaii
text:
Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa. Photo Coutesy of the Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa About.com Rating 
It always worries me to return to a favorite resort after it has changed management. Will everything be as good as or even better than I remember? Such was the case when I returned to the newly renovated Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa in the fall of 2008. 
On our first trip to the Big Island of Hawaii in the early 1990's, we stayed at the resort when it was operated under the Outrigger brand. My wife and I both had very fond memories of our stay. 
I am pleased to tell you that the resort, now managed by Marriott International, is bigger and better than ever. 
More recently, in February 2015, the resort was purchased by Silverwest Hotel Partners . The new owners plan to keep Marriott as the manager of the hotel. The Rebirth of a Resort 
For those of you who stayed at the resort prior to its 2007 renovation, I can tell you that most of what you probably enjoyed the most is still there. 
The basic layout of the hotel will seem very familiar. The lobby is still open-air with great views of the pool area, fishponds and ocean beyond. All of these areas have been dramatically improved. 
The guest rooms themselves are now some of the most modern and updated in Hawaii. They still, however, retain much of that special island charm. If you select a view with an ocean view, you'll witness some of the best sunsets in Hawaii right from your own lanai. 
The lobby has the feel of an oceanside resort. Materials and colors bring the feel of the blue sky, blue-green water and golden beach right inside. New seating areas allow plenty of room to just sit and enjoy the views. 
The Kona Coffee Shoppe provides a great place to purchase a light breakfast or that morning cup of Kona Coffee. 
A new 12,000-square-foot Naupaka Ballroom with its own lovely lawn area doubled the resort’s total indoor meeting space. A new two-level Mandara Spa with seven treatment rooms and a full service salon was added. Room Amenities 
The Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa features six floors with 533 rooms and 22 suites. 
All guest rooms are wired for high speed Internet access. All public areas offer wireless connectivity. 
General room amenities include air conditioning, alarm clock, flat screen cable TV, safe, coffee maker/tea service, individual climate controls, iron and ironing board, luxurious bedding - down comforters, custom duvets, cotton-rich linens. 
Some rooms include a pull-out sofa bed. Rollaway beds are available. Fine Dining and Plenty of Things to Do and See 
New is the outdoor Hawaii Calls Restaurant & Lounge. Seating is available close to the pool area as well as a section protected from any inclement weather. My wife and I enjoyed the wonderful breakfast buffet each morning. 
The pool area has been totally reworked. You can't help but be impressed by the resort's new heated infinity pool. Children and adults alike all seemed to enjoy the new water slide area. 
The pool deck is huge. It always seems possible to find your own private little space to enjoy the water. 
The Sunset Luau is offered twice weekly in an area adjacent to the pool deck. The luau has classic Polynesian entertainment including music and traditional dances of the South Pacific. A delectable selection of Hawaiian food is served. Historic Fishponds and Beach 
One of the highlights of the resort has always been the historic fishpond area that sits between the hotel's pool deck and lawn area and the beach. The stonework has been restored and lighting improved. 
The area allows guests to become acquainted firsthand with the history and cultural significance of the Big Island's Anaeho'omalu Bay and the King's Trail. 
Once you make your way to the beach, you'll find one of my favorite beaches in Hawaii where the snorkeling is excellent. 
Catamaran rides, glass bottom boat rides, boogie boards, kayaks and snorkeling equipment area available. A Destination Resort on Hawaii's Big Island 
The Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa is located within the Waikoloa Beach Resort . I was pleased to learn that the various hotels, condominiums and businesses within the resort work together to encourage guests to take full advantage of the offerings of the entire resort 
Guests at the Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa can enjoy a round of golf at either the Robert Trent Jones, Jr. Beach Course or the Kings' Course, designed by Tom Weiskopf and Jay Morrish. 
Guests can shop till you drop at the King's Shops or the newer Queens' Marketplace . 
You can experience a dolphin encounter at the Hilton Waikoloa Village's Dolphin Quest or enjoy lunch or dinner at the Clubhouse, King's Shops, Queens' Marketplace or at one of the Hilton Waikoloa Village’s fine restaurants . 
This concept of a "destination resort" has worked exceptionally well in areas such as the Ka'anapali Resort area on Maui. I'm delighted to see that the members of the Waikoloa Beach Resort have adopted the same concept. If You Go 
Waikoloa Beach Marriott Resort & Spa69-275 Waikoloa Beach DriveWaikoloa - Hawaii, Hawaii 96738 USAPhone: 1-808-886-6789 
The resort is located 18 miles north of Kona International Airport on the Queen Kaahumanu Highway or Highway 19.
